intro: Planaltoa, commonly known as the "false holly," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae. It is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, often brightly colored flowers. The plants typically grow in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils and sunny to partially shaded environments. Planaltoa species are often used in ornamental horticulture due to their attractive appearance and hardiness. They play a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
